intro: Deguelia grevei, commonly known as the greenbottle bush, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces distinctive seed pods that are often inflated and can contain a single seed. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Deguelia grevei is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, contributing to soil fertility.
